result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin L Lazcon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If defendant successfully completes probation and remains crime free for one year after completion of same, defendant may motion the Court for expungement.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must provide a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: Must serve 3 months. Huber is granted for employment and/or treatment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required.  3 months are stayed.
to be completed during the term of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. May not associate with any known gang members or drug users. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, unless one has already been submitted. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Martin L Lazcon
Current: 2327 Grove Ave, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 03-04-2014)
Prior: 3133 Kearney Av, Racine, WI 53403
Preliminary hearing on March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Martin L Lazcon in court with attorney Katie Gutowski.  Defendant Martin L Lazcon in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
